The 20-year-old Eredivisie sensation has drawn attention from Liverpool and Napoli.

Football Nitale · 27/08/2023

Liverpool and Napoli show interest in PSV’s Johan Bakayoko

﻿Dutch winger Johan Bakayoko has been linked to Liverpool amid a flurry of transfer rumors.

That's what Eindhovens Dagblad sports writer and PSV fan Rik Elfrink told the Dutch news service Twitter [hat tip: liverpool.com]. The 20-year-old Belgian international is being monitored by both Liverpool and Napoli.

This information puts Bakayoko's transfer fee between £21 million and £26 million. While the numbers point to a bright future, it is crucial to take into account Liverpool's strategic aims and the current makeup of their team.

Rik Elfrink's disclosure is significant because it shows that Liverpool's scouting network is always searching Europe for new potential. The fact that Liverpool is showing interest in Bakayoko shows that the club is serious about scouting for talent that may help improve the team in the future.

A deeper look at Liverpool's present requirements and additions, though, suggests a different path. Cody Gakpo, formerly of PSV, joined Liverpool in January and immediately improved the team's offensive. With a strong offensive quartet already in place (Mohamed Salah, Diogo Jota, Luis Diaz, and Darwin Nunez), it seems that the club is no longer prioritizing attacking additions.

Liverpool is now focusing mostly on improving their defense. Fans and analysts agree that the team needs a strong defender to pair alongside Virgil van Dijk and Ibrahima Konate, as well as a dependable defensive midfielder.

Liverpool's strategic strategy is highlighted by Jurgen Klopp's focus on a solid defense and a powerful midfield. While the Reds' interest in Johan Bakayoko is understandable given his potential, the team has other priorities at the moment.
